text: Interesting that Naheb went from gold to mono.
Sacrifice a desert to exile all cards from all graveyards
Entirely tactical on Bolas' part. He knows the Gatewatch are basically interdimensional police, so he figured the best way to keep his minions from getting killed is to make them be not black.
Nice. I've got decks that want that for sure.
Really hoping we get a 1G Rampant Growth for deserts
[[aggravated assault]]

attachments.fallback: Aggravated Assault {2}{R} // Enchantment // {3}{R}{R}: Untap all creatures you control. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
{3}{R}{R}: Untap all creatures you control. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

text: One thing thats cute is that after multiple combat steps, the mana adds up
First time you attack you get 6 mana. You attack again now you get 12
Attack again get 18
Sorry im saying multiples of 6, its multiples of 4
Oh Aggravated Assault...how easily we abuse thee.
Oh neat, I read it as "first post-combat main phase" first time through
So you just need to, cumulatively, have opponents take 5 damage after combat phase to go infinite with AA...that is a damn low bar.
Or just have 1 mana open and connect a second time
Nuts
Yeah...it may be a little too efficient.
You have to be able to connect though. One person is always open though
<@U3L7A68JC> there's no such thing as too efficient, only those not willing to be that brutal.
Or something like that

literal nothing
what do you think <@U32LRG9NU>

Doesn't take much for old cards like that to go up and stay there

Well, just using my previous example of blowfly infestation, which went up because of 1 deck, decree is older and a rare so it probably has more upside even at $.75. Blowfly went up to $4ish where it's settled, decree will probably go to even $5, buylist then would probably be at least $2.50 in that case for a bit.
So still a triple up.
I'm definitely an amateur with the mtgfinance and only do it for fun though.
but blowfly infestation went up because of a deck
decree is going up because of a single card interaction

Even if you just trade a lot it'll probably pay off. I trade a lot on Deckbox, so here's what probably happens for me: i spent my four dollars on a playset, which i'll get in and toss in with my blue tradestock. Nothing happens for a few months, until like October when I go to make a deal with someone and see he has Decree on his want list. I put it in the trade, we agree, and the swap happens. Rise and repeat three more times over the next year or so. My four dollars winds up as 20-ish in trade value.
Right, only -1/-1 counter decks. There are tons of UWx decks that would play decree
Nothing amazing, but it adds up
I'm not saying it's not good value, just actually curious how much
ok
More appeal to the broad sense
A single card interaction is better than a deck, though
A single interaction that can go in a slew of different decks
oh
More people playing the interaction, more demand.
With a lower supply
Can anyone think of any blue and white decks that like to counter spells?
It's a good card in Brago for example, but only like 5% of Brago decks run it. Add another card to interact with it and suddenly it becomes much more attractive to Brago players
<@U32LRG9NU> no.
ok, so, in fairness the new combo piece does nothing unless you interact with it
so a better question would be "does anyone know WU decks that will tutor for enchantments and like to combo out"

text: That rate is pretty sweet and in the right deck so is the discard.
Elephant Grass is already semi-playable
Sure but if you remove the downside...:sunglasses:
For sure

I wouldn't run Solemnity just for it, but if you're already running Solemnity in the deck then it makes EG much, much more tempting to add, or if you're already running EG and Solemnity doesn't bite you in the ass then Solemnity it becomes way more tempting, etc
Indeed. I wouldn't put it in just for a single card, without tutors, but it can sure enable some fun times.

It's going to cause cascades in some of my decks. It benefits Remora, Chasm, and Vexing Sphinx (kinda) in my sphinx deck, doesn't hurt me, and provides good hate, so I'll run it there. So since I'm running it do I then throw in Dark Depths? And since I'm running DD, then I probably need to look at Thespian's Stage and/or Vesuva
It is a fairly parasitic card.
I have just noticed that Solemnity makes Noyan Dar pretty sad
It's probably going to work defensively against at least one deck in most games, though.
you can tell Ghave players to calm down
It's kind of like Rest in Peace in that even if you aren't using it as part of a combo or something it's still useful defensively against at least one person every game
Hits Marchesa hard too
OG Marchesa
Right but the inverse isn't true - if you put in a lot of cards with upkeep downside unless you get Solemnity out and keep it those becomes bad.
oh fur sure
This is a card that leads to Magical Xmasland deck building.
At least in the cases I mentioned I was already running three of the cards, and it's not like adding Dark Depths or Thespian's Stage to a deck is really risky
I meant more the upkeep cards.
But you totally don't want to start stacking cumulative upkeep cards that aren't decent unless you happen to get Solemnity out and sticking for multiple turns
